result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador R Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Case 15CM1849, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.

Domestic Counseling or Anger Mangement and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint, their residences or anywhere the victims are at.
No violent contact with K.K. (girlfriend) and only with her permission.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

AMENDED 11-12-2015:  Restitution was originally ordered in the amount of $2121.69 in defendant's Case 15CM1494.  Cash bail of $150 has been applied leaving a balance owed of $1,971.69 and transferred to this case.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salvador R Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Letter dated 8/16/16 filed by defendant requesting sentence credit.

8/17/16 - No action taken; letter from court sent to defendant on 8/16/16 regarding sentence credit.
Response letter from court to defendant regarding his request for a current assessment report (defendant was advised to contact the Department of Corrections).
Inmate communicationi form filed by defendant regarding sentence credit and his release from custody.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with attached copies of Judgment of Conviction, requesting they be amended and corrected to show restitution owing on 15CM1494, not on case 15CM1863.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Salvador R Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to:  case 15CM1849
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
DV Counseling or Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint, their residences or anywhere the victims are at.
No Violent Contact with:  Victim K.K. (girlfriend) and Only with her permission.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

RESTITUTION:  $2,121.69 (to be paid to Victim (E.Z.) - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
To be paid within the first 12 Months of Probation.
Defense has 30 Days to request a restitution hearing.
State has 15 days from today's date to provide restitution verification to the defense.

Cash bail set at:  $250
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Ms. Kathryn Kowaski and not to discuss any of the circumstances of the any of the cases.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Standard conditions apply.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Salvador R Hernandez in court, in custody.  
Attorney Rosario appeared as friend of the court.

Defendant did receive a copy of the criminal complaint in court and waives reading.
Not Guilty plea entered.

Cash bail set at:  $250
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Ms. Kathryn Kowaski and not to discuss any of the circumstances of the any of the cases.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Standard conditions apply.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 11:30 am.
